title: "Compensation buffs"
body:
Before its removal, DFG was core on both {{champion:45}} and {{champion:7}}. However, since it has been removed, only veigar has recieved his compensation buffs!!!! This is an outrage, leblanc can hardly stand on her own feet without dfg. I move that riot puts leblanc back into the game with some drastic buffs, such as making her q a skillshot, lowering the ap ratios on the jump, and adding a .75 second delay on her chains.

Oh, but dont worry about this hurting leblancs gameplay. They would totally clean up her auto attack to make  sure the counterplay doesnt hurt her too much.

seriously though.

With the removal of veigar from the game, I had no idea what to pick against leblanc.

so I searched the internet. 

Galio and Morekaiser.

Seriously? 

THOSE guys are my only hope against this solo queqe monster?

replies.body: Trick question. In solo queue you're screwed no matter what, because even if you win lane, she'll just roam bot for the free double kills (even if you ping MIA)

Everytime I pinged AS SHE LEFT LANE IN THE DIRECTION SHE WAS GOING... *DOUBLE KILL*
Exactly like all assassins, which is why they're seen/banned all the time in solo queue.

But yeah, you should be following the enemy laner or making them pay for it in some other way, lost experience, lost tower, or otherwise.
you can always run tp.
Running TP mid?
Yes for immobile mages that already have a huge kill presence it is great to counter roam.

True, and sometimes I do if im mid and not an assassin or if toplane doesn't have tp.

Only downside is then LB would have even more kill pressure over you in lane because she has an offensive summoner and you don't.
yes but we are going to assume that you are a better player than Le Blanc. So you won't feed her and than you can counter roam very easily when she leaves lane.
Haha, yup, let's do that.  It's so frustrating when you are beating an assassin in lane and they just roam around for a couple minutes and despite your efforts and pings your team feeds them.

Yeah, you're right. Before I used to just ping my bot lane when the enemy gets missing in lane and just continue pushing and farming. But in some lower elos, people won't watch out until the danger is right in their face...Even if they stay to tower, LeBlanc can tower dive from behind if she is capable of doing so. Thus, these days I just roam with the enemy mid laner and try to gank him/her and the enemies on the same lane. Afterwords, I push the lane when with my allies or defend the tower, depending on the outcome of the battle.
I usually prefer to push the lane hard and make her come back to no tower, though now that towers give less team gold that might not be as great a strategy.

Well, I personally prefer coming bot anyway. If the enemy mid laner goes bot, I go after him/her and win bot with my allies, we'll be able to push the bot turret.

If I lose the battle (depends a lot on the situation) I'll retreat to the turret and save it with my teammates. If we win we get a free tower on bot lane and secure some kills. Either I win a lot or lose less than what I could've lost. The mid turrets usually get pushed out in mid and late game, so having an opportunity to push one early shouldn't come when the enemy's roaming poses a threat. Roaming is probably the best way to snowball an entire game. So I often do it whenever I get the chance to secure different objectives.
True story
If her Chains had a 0.75s delay they would actually be 50% faster.

Five man ult? Aaaand it's a wiff. Whoops I screwed? Hey, cool, double kill, blue buff and baron!

A good Malzahar is a really strong pick against LB because he can easily lock her down with silence and ult. Yes its hard to silence her quickest combo while you are in the middle of your lane but she can't harass you in turret range, she can't cut your farm off and she can't just leash you waiting for dmg while having her W ready to jump out.

Also Malza can build a little bit more tanky than other mages thanks to his AOE %hp dmg and really good ratios.

But lets be real, its hard to find good Malzahar.
Seems like all the Malzahars I face just spam their void aids on the wave and go do ~~wraiths~~ raptors or something. So IDK what makes a good Malzahar.

I always check Malza players for:

1. AA poisoned targets to get mana refund.
2. Effective use of his Voidlings.
3. Fast and Fluent combos.
4. Using his double dmg on Q when possible.
5. Good roams when ult up.
6. Knowledge how much dmg he can dish.
7. Defensive play only when forced by a jungler.

If he is doing all those things you should probably watch out and build QQS before 45 mins in the game.

That's actually fair advice. The missile speed on the spear is uber slow. You just have to make it idiot proof for your botlane.  Ping EVERY mia.  Also, putting a pink ward in your botside river brush pays HUGE dividends in low elo especially.  People just don't check that little bush.  It gives your laners a heads up if she is moving bot though river.  The tribush at the botlane is a little more problematic because you cant ideal ward it yourself because its too far away.  Additonally, my general rule of thumb is if I am mid lane and my laner is missing, if I cant take the tower, I am just going to head bot lane as 9 out of 10 times that's where their mid laner is along with probably their jungle and they are going to need all the help they can get.

Le Blanc. Thats who we are going to complain about now. Great. Even though she is perfectly balanced, you want to nerf her. Le Blanc might be able to 100-0 you, but thats all she can do. Have you seen her team fighting potential? Because it is really sad.
Right, but LB isn't meant to be a big team fighter. She's an assassin mage, intended to nullify one or two targets per fight.
Right that is her weakness. When there is a teamfight she gets deleted immediately.
A good LB is basically uncatchable though.
This is true. Le Blanc has got to be one of the most slippery champs. That makes her a good assassin.

what? her ability to root people? Her ability to delete the carry and essentially win the fight at the start? Her ability to draw aggro and dodge CC? Her ability to leave visual range and force the enemy to play cautiously?

She has great teamfight, it's just not in the form of a hard CC multi-target ultimate.
You have to isolate the carry if you want to kill them. If you try to run into a teamfight as Le Blanc then you will get deleted. She is pure damage all squish.
If she gets her distortion and mimic both on 3 or more people its basically gg even if she dies half a second later.
AP carry dying to kill ADC is a good trade. Always.
Personally I'd prefer to see the .75 second delay on her jump, complete with a warning particle.
